member.summary: Container for the parameters to the PutReportDefinition operation. Creates a new report using the description that you provide.

member.name: P:Amazon.CostAndUsageReport.Model.PutReportDefinitionRequest.ReportDefinition
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReportDefinition.
Represents the output of the PutReportDefinition operation. The content consists of the detailed metadata and data file information.

member.name: T:Amazon.CostAndUsageReport.Model.PutReportDefinitionResponse
member.summary: If the action is successful, the service sends back an HTTP 200 response with an empty HTTP body.

member.name: T:Amazon.CostAndUsageReport.Model.ReportDefinition
member.summary: The definition of AWS Cost and Usage Report. You can specify the report name, time unit, report format, compression format, S3 bucket, additional artifacts, and schema elements in the definition.

member.name: P:Amazon.CostAndUsageReport.Model.ReportDefinition.AdditionalArtifacts
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AdditionalArtifacts.
A list of manifests that you want Amazon Web Services to create for this report.

member.name: P:Amazon.CostAndUsageReport.Model.ReportDefinition.AdditionalSchemaElements
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AdditionalSchemaElements.
A list of strings that indicate additional content that Amazon Web Services includes in the report, such as individual resource IDs.

member.name: P:Amazon.CostAndUsageReport.Model.ReportDefinition.BillingViewArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BillingViewArn.
The Amazon resource name of the billing view. You can get this value by using the billing view service public APIs.

member.name: P:Amazon.CostAndUsageReport.Model.ReportDefinition.Compression
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Compression.

member.name: P:Amazon.CostAndUsageReport.Model.ReportDefinition.Format
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Format.

member.name: P:Amazon.CostAndUsageReport.Model.ReportDefinition.RefreshClosedReports
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RefreshClosedReports.
Whether you want Amazon Web Services to update your reports after they have been finalized if Amazon Web Services detects charges related to previous months. These charges can include refunds, credits, or support fees.

member.name: P:Amazon.CostAndUsageReport.Model.ReportDefinition.ReportName
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ReportName.

member.name: P:Amazon.CostAndUsageReport.Model.ReportDefinition.ReportVersioning
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReportVersioning.
Whether you want Amazon Web Services to overwrite the previous version of each report or to deliver the report in addition to the previous versions.

member.summary: Gets and sets the property S3Bucket.

member.name: T:Amazon.CostAndUsageReport.AmazonCostAndUsageReportClient
member.summary:
Implementation for accessing CostAndUsageReport
The AWS Cost and Usage Report API enables you to programmatically create, query, and delete AWS Cost and Usage report definitions.
AWS Cost and Usage reports track the monthly AWS costs and usage associated with your AWS account. The report contains line items for each unique combination of AWS product, usage type, and operation that your AWS account uses. You can configure the AWS Cost and Usage report to show only the data that you want, using the AWS Cost and Usage API.
Service Endpoint
The AWS Cost and Usage Report API provides the following endpoint:
cur.us-east-1.amazonaws.com

member.name: P:Amazon.CostAndUsageReport.AmazonCostAndUsageReportClient.Paginators
member.summary: Paginators for the service

member.name: M:Amazon.CostAndUsageReport.AmazonCostAndUsageReportClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonCostAndUsageReportClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.name: M:Amazon.CostAndUsageReport.AmazonCostAndUsageReportClient.#ctor(Amazon.RegionEndpoint)
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonCostAndUsageReportClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.

member.param: The region to connect.
